# Meteum Postman Collection [![Postman](https://img.shields.io/badge/Postman-FF6C37?style=for-the-badge&logo=postman&logoColor=white)](https://www.postman.com/meteum)

Meteum provides a rich GraphQL API to retrieve historic, current, and forecast data worldwide. This includes model data and observational data in time series.

This is an example set for Postman to showcase some of the capabilities of our weather API.

If you are looking for a more in-depth guide and reference for the Meteum GraphQL API, please refer to [documentation](https://docs.meteum.ai).

## Getting started
Follow these steps to quickly get started with the [Meteum API](https://docs.meteum.ai):

1. [Sign up](https://meteum.ai/b2b/console) with Meteum to get a set of API keys that are required for interacting with the API.
2. Click on the button below to fork the collection so that you could alter it for your need (or import [examples](./GraphQL%20Examples.postman_collection.json) and [environment](Meteum%20API.postman_environment.json) files).
3. Don't forget to add your `apikey` in HTTP request header `X-Meteum-API-Key`.
4. Change the query/path/body parameters.
5. Click "Send".


[![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://god.gw.postman.com/run-collection/24475012-04ede69d-12e2-4c49-adc8-12f510a19ff5?action=collection%2Ffork&collection-url=entityId%3D24475012-04ede69d-12e2-4c49-adc8-12f510a19ff5%26entityType%3Dcollection%26workspaceId%3Dec3382a2-8e8e-4d74-8412-748de265a5b2#?env%5BMeteum%20API%)
